DOCNAME: CASE OF J.V. AND OTHERS v. SLOVAKIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Constitutional proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants claimed compensation for damage to their health ( infection with Hepatitis C ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE I ORG dismissed their action .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , upon the applicants ' appeal , quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case file for further examination to the district court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants complained to the President of the district court about undue delays . On DATE the President of the court concerned acknowledged that there had been delays in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE the district court held hearings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that GPE had violated the applicants ' right to a hearing without unjustified delay . ORG awarded CARDINAL NORP PERSON ( SKK ) to each applicant as just satisfaction in respect of non - pecuniary damage , ordered the district court to avoid further delays and to reimburse the applicants ' legal costs .
CARDINAL . Second set of constitutional proceedings

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that , in the period after its previous ruling , the Bratislava I ORG had violated the applicants ' right to a hearing without unjustified delay . ORG awarded SKK CARDINAL to each applicant as just satisfaction in respect of non - pecuniary damage , ordered the district court to avoid further delays and to reimburse the applicants ' legal costs .
